provisioningState.Description: Provisioning state of the App Service Environment.

status.Description: Current status of the App Service Environment.

internalLoadBalancingMode.Description: Specifies which endpoints to serve internally in the Virtual Network for the App Service Environment.

ipsslAddressCount.Description: Number of IP SSL addresses reserved for the App Service Environment.

dnsSuffix.Description: DNS suffix of the App Service Environment.

maximumNumberOfMachines.Description: Maximum number of VMs in the App Service Environment.

suspended.Description: true if the App Service Environment is suspended; otherwise, false. The environment can be suspended, e.g. when the management endpoint is no longer available (most likely because NSG blocked the incoming traffic).

clusterSettings.Description: Custom settings for changing the behavior of the App Service Environment.

userWhitelistedIpRanges.Description: User added list of IP Ranges allowed on ASE db

hasLinuxWorkers.Description: Flag that displays whether an ASE has linux workers or not

zoneRedundant.Description: Whether or not this App Service Environment is zone-redundant.

customDnsSuffixConfiguration.Description: Full view of the custom domain suffix configuration for ASEv3.

networkingConfiguration.Description: Full view of networking configuration for an ASE.

upgradeAvailability.Description: Whether an upgrade is available for this App Service Environment.

id.Description: Resource id of the Virtual Network.

type.Description: Resource type of the Virtual Network (read-only).

dnsSuffix.Description: The default custom domain suffix to use for all sites deployed on the ASE.

certificateUrl.Description: The URL referencing the Azure Key Vault certificate secret that should be used as the default SSL/TLS certificate for sites with the custom domain suffix.

keyVaultReferenceIdentity.Description: The user-assigned identity to use for resolving the key vault certificate reference. If not specified, the system-assigned ASE identity will be used if available.

allowNewPrivateEndpointConnections.Description: Property to enable and disable new private endpoint connection creation on ASE

ftpEnabled.Description: Property to enable and disable FTP on ASEV3

remoteDebugEnabled.Description: Property to enable and disable Remote Debug on ASEV3

inboundIpAddressOverride.Description: Customer provided Inbound IP Address. Only able to be set on Ase create.

sku.Description: Description of a SKU for a scalable resource.

workerSizeId.Description: Worker size ID for referencing this worker pool.

workerSize.Description: VM size of the worker pool instances.

workerCount.Description: Number of instances in the worker pool.

instanceNames.Description: Names of all instances in the worker pool (read only).

tier.Description: Service tier of the resource SKU.

size.Description: Size specifier of the resource SKU.

family.Description: Family code of the resource SKU.

capacity.Description: Current number of instances assigned to the resource.

skuCapacity.Description: Min, max, and default scale values of the SKU.

capabilities.Description: Capabilities of the SKU, e.g., is traffic manager enabled?

minimum.Description: Minimum number of workers for this App Service plan SKU.

maximum.Description: Maximum number of workers for this App Service plan SKU.

elasticMaximum.Description: Maximum number of Elastic workers for this App Service plan SKU.

default.Description: Default number of workers for this App Service plan SKU.

scaleType.Description: Available scale configurations for an App Service plan.

privateLinkServiceConnectionState.Description: The state of a private link connection

privateEndpoint.Description: PrivateEndpoint of a remote private endpoint connection

ipAddresses.Description: Private IPAddresses mapped to the remote private endpoint

status.Description: Status of a private link connection

description.Description: Description of a private link connection

actionsRequired.Description: ActionsRequired for a private link connection

sku.Description: Description of a SKU for a scalable resource.
Description of a SKU for a scalable resource.

workerTierName.Description: Target worker tier assigned to the App Service plan.

hostingEnvironmentProfile.Description: Specification for the App Service Environment to use for the App Service plan.

maximumNumberOfWorkers.Description: Maximum number of instances that can be assigned to this App Service plan.

numberOfWorkers.Description: The number of instances that are assigned to this App Service plan.

geoRegion.Description: Geographical location for the App Service plan.

perSiteScaling.Description: If true, apps assigned to this App Service plan can be scaled independently. If false, apps assigned to this App Service plan will scale to all instances of the plan.

elasticScaleEnabled.Description: ServerFarm supports ElasticScale. Apps in this plan will scale as if the ServerFarm was ElasticPremium sku

maximumElasticWorkerCount.Description: Maximum number of total workers allowed for this ElasticScaleEnabled App Service Plan

numberOfSites.Description: Number of apps assigned to this App Service plan.

isSpot.Description: If true, this App Service Plan owns spot instances.

spotExpirationTime.Description: The time when the server farm expires. Valid only if it is a spot server farm.

freeOfferExpirationTime.Description: The time when the server farm free offer expires.

resourceGroup.Description: Resource group of the App Service plan.

reserved.Description: If Linux app service plan true, false otherwise.

isXenon.Description: Obsolete: If Hyper-V container app service plan true, false otherwise.

hyperV.Description: If Hyper-V container app service plan true, false otherwise.

provisioningState.Description: Provisioning state of the App Service Plan.

kubeEnvironmentProfile.Description: Specification for the Kubernetes Environment to use for the App Service plan.

zoneRedundant.Description: If true, this App Service Plan will perform availability zone balancing. If false, this App Service Plan will not perform availability zone balancing.

id.Description: Resource ID of the App Service Environment.

name.Description: Name of the App Service Environment.

type.Description: Resource type of the App Service Environment.

id.Description: Resource ID of the Kubernetes Environment.

type.Description: Resource type of the Kubernetes Environment.

vpnPackageUri.Description: The URI where the VPN package can be downloaded.

startAddress.Description: The starting address for this route. This may also include a CIDR notation, in which case the end address must not be specified.

endAddress.Description: The ending address for this route. If the start address is specified in CIDR notation, this must be omitted.

routeType.Description:
The type of route this is:
DEFAULT - By default, every app has routes to the local address ranges specified by RFC1918
INHERITED - Routes inherited from the real Virtual Network routes
STATIC - Static route set on the app only

These values will be used for syncing an app's routes with those from a Virtual Network.

hostNames.Description: Host names the certificate applies to.

hostingEnvironmentProfile.Description: Specification for the App Service Environment to use for the certificate.

keyVaultSecretStatus.Description: Status of the Key Vault secret.

serverFarmId.Description: Resource ID of the associated App Service plan, formatted as: "/subscriptions/{subscriptionID}/resourceGroups/{groupName}/providers/Microsoft.Web/serverfarms/{appServicePlanName}".

canonicalName.Description: CNAME of the certificate to be issued via free certificate

domainValidationMethod.Description: Method of domain validation for free cert

provisioningState.Description: Provisioning state of the Container App.

kubeEnvironmentId.Description: Resource ID of the Container App's KubeEnvironment.

latestRevisionName.Description: Name of the latest revision of the Container App.

latestRevisionFqdn.Description: Fully Qualified Domain Name of the latest revision of the Container App.

configuration.Description: Non versioned Container App configuration properties.

secrets.Description: Collection of secrets used by a Container app

activeRevisionsMode.Description:
ActiveRevisionsMode controls how active revisions are handled for the Container app:
<list><item>Multiple: multiple revisions can be active. If no value if provided, this is the default</item><item>Single: Only one revision can be active at a time. Revision weights can not be used in this mode</item></list>

registries.Description: Collection of private container registry credentials for containers used by the Container app

external.Description: Bool indicating if app exposes an external http endpoint

targetPort.Description: Target Port in containers for traffic from ingress

allowInsecure.Description: Bool indicating if HTTP connections to is allowed. If set to false HTTP connections are automatically redirected to HTTPS connections

weight.Description: Traffic weight assigned to a revision

latestRevision.Description: Indicates that the traffic weight belongs to a latest stable revision

passwordSecretRef.Description: The name of the Secret that contains the registry login password

revisionSuffix.Description: User friendly suffix that is appended to the revision name

containers.Description: List of container definitions for the Container App.

scale.Description: Scaling properties for the Container App.

dapr.Description: Dapr configuration for the Container App.

secretRef.Description: Name of the Container App secret from which to pull the environment variable value.

minReplicas.Description: Optional. Minimum number of container replicas.

maxReplicas.Description: Optional. Maximum number of container replicas. Defaults to 10 if not set.

auth.Description: Authentication secrets for the queue scale rule.

secretRef.Description: Name of the Container App secret from which to pull the auth params.

triggerParameter.Description: Trigger Parameter that uses the secret

type.Description:
Type of the custom scale rule
eg: azure-servicebus, redis etc.

metadata.Description: Metadata properties to describe custom scale rule.

auth.Description: Authentication secrets for the custom scale rule.

metadata.Description: Metadata properties to describe http scale rule.

auth.Description: Authentication secrets for the custom scale rule.

enabled.Description: Boolean indicating if the Dapr side car is enabled

appPort.Description: Port on which the Dapr side car

secretRef.Description: Name of the Container App secret from which to pull the metadata property value.

provisioningState.Description: Provisioning state of the Kubernetes Environment.

deploymentErrors.Description: Any errors that occurred during deployment or deployment validation

defaultDomain.Description: Default Domain Name for the cluster

environmentType.Description: Type of Kubernetes Environment. Only supported for Container App Environments with value as Managed

arcConfiguration.Description:
Cluster configuration which determines the ARC cluster
components types. Eg: Choosing between BuildService kind,
FrontEnd Service ArtifactsStorageType etc.

appLogsConfiguration.Description:
Cluster configuration which enables the log daemon to export
app logs to a destination. Currently only "log-analytics" is
supported

containerAppsConfiguration.Description: Cluster configuration for Container Apps Environments to configure Dapr Instrumentation Key and VNET Configuration

daprAIInstrumentationKey.Description: Azure Monitor instrumentation key used by Dapr to export Service to Service communication telemetry

platformReservedCidr.Description: IP range in CIDR notation that can be reserved for environment infrastructure IP addresses. It must not overlap with any other Subnet IP ranges.

platformReservedDnsIP.Description: An IP address from the IP range defined by platformReservedCidr that will be reserved for the internal DNS server

controlPlaneSubnetResourceId.Description: Resource ID of a subnet for control plane infrastructure components. This subnet must be in the same VNET as the subnet defined in appSubnetResourceId. Must not overlap with the IP range defined in platformReservedCidr, if defined.

appSubnetResourceId.Description: Resource ID of a subnet for control plane infrastructure components. This subnet must be in the same VNET as the subnet defined in appSubnetResourceId. Must not overlap with the IP range defined in platformReservedCidr, if defined.

dockerBridgeCidr.Description: CIDR notation IP range assigned to the Docker bridge network. It must not overlap with any Subnet IP ranges or the IP range defined in platformReservedCidr, if defined.

publishingPasswordHashSalt.Description: Password hash salt used for publishing.

sku.Description: Description of a SKU for a scalable resource.

defaultHostname.Description: The default autogenerated hostname for the static site.

repositoryUrl.Description: URL for the repository of the static site.

branch.Description: The target branch in the repository.

customDomains.Description: The custom domains associated with this static site.

repositoryToken.Description: A user's github repository token. This is used to setup the Github Actions workflow file and API secrets.

buildProperties.Description: Build properties to configure on the repository.

stagingEnvironmentPolicy.Description: State indicating whether staging environments are allowed or not allowed for a static web app.

allowConfigFileUpdates.Description: false if config file is locked for this static web app; otherwise, true.

templateProperties.Description: Template options for generating a new repository.

contentDistributionEndpoint.Description: The content distribution endpoint for the static site.

keyVaultReferenceIdentity.Description: Identity to use for Key Vault Reference authentication.

userProvidedFunctionApps.Description: User provided function apps registered with the static site

linkedBackends.Description: Backends linked to the static side

provider.Description: The provider that submitted the last deployment to the primary environment of the static site.

enterpriseGradeCdnStatus.Description: State indicating the status of the enterprise grade CDN serving traffic to the static web app.

publicNetworkAccess.Description: State indicating whether public traffic are allowed or not for a static web app. Allowed Values: 'Enabled', 'Disabled' or an empty string.

appLocation.Description: The path to the app code within the repository.

apiLocation.Description: The path to the api code within the repository.

appArtifactLocation.Description: Deprecated: The path of the app artifacts after building (deprecated in favor of OutputLocation)

outputLocation.Description: The output path of the app after building.

appBuildCommand.Description: A custom command to run during deployment of the static content application.

apiBuildCommand.Description: A custom command to run during deployment of the Azure Functions API application.

location.Description: Geographical region resource belongs to e.g. SouthCentralUS, SouthEastAsia.

zones.Description: Logical Availability Zones the service is hosted in

privateEndpoint.Description: PrivateEndpoint of a remote private endpoint connection

privateLinkServiceConnectionState.Description: The state of a private link connection

ipAddresses.Description: Private IPAddresses mapped to the remote private endpoint

principalId.Description: Principal Id of managed service identity.

userAssignedIdentities.Description: The list of user assigned identities associated with the resource. The user identity dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}

principalId.Description: Principal Id of user assigned identity

clientId.Description: Client Id of user assigned identity

templateRepositoryUrl.Description: URL of the template repository. The newly generated repository will be based on this one.

owner.Description: Owner of the newly generated repository.

repositoryName.Description: Name of the newly generated repository.

description.Description: Description of the newly generated repository.

isPrivate.Description: Whether or not the newly generated repository is a private repository. Defaults to false (i.e. public).

functionAppResourceId.Description: The resource id of the function app registered with the static site

functionAppRegion.Description: The region of the function app registered with the static site

createdOn.Description: The date and time on which the function app was registered with the static site.

backendResourceId.Description: The resource id of the backend linked to the static site

region.Description: The region of the backend linked to the static site

createdOn.Description: The date and time on which the backend was linked to the static site.

provisioningState.Description: The provisioning state of the linking process.

functionAppResourceId.Description: The resource id of the function app registered with the static site

functionAppRegion.Description: The region of the function app registered with the static site

createdOn.Description: The date and time on which the function app was registered with the static site.

validationMethod.Description: Validation method for adding a custom domain

domainName.Description: The domain name for the static site custom domain.

createdOn.Description: The date and time on which the custom domain was created for the static site.

status.Description: The status of the custom domain

backendResourceId.Description: The resource id of the backend linked to the static site

region.Description: The region of the backend linked to the static site

createdOn.Description: The date and time on which the backend was linked to the static site.

provisioningState.Description: The provisioning state of the linking process.

usageState.Description: State indicating whether the app has exceeded its quota usage. Read-only.

enabled.Description: true if the app is enabled; otherwise, false. Setting this value to false disables the app (takes the app offline).

enabledHostNames.Description:
Enabled hostnames for the app.Hostnames need to be assigned (see HostNames) AND enabled. Otherwise,
the app is not served on those hostnames.

availabilityState.Description: Management information availability state for the app.

hostNameSslStates.Description: Hostname SSL states are used to manage the SSL bindings for app's hostnames.

serverFarmId.Description: Resource ID of the associated App Service plan, formatted as: "/subscriptions/{subscriptionID}/resourceGroups/{groupName}/providers/Microsoft.Web/serverfarms/{appServicePlanName}".

lastModifiedTimeUtc.Description: Last time the app was modified, in UTC. Read-only.

vnetRouteAllEnabled.Description: Virtual Network Route All enabled. This causes all outbound traffic to have Virtual Network Security Groups and User Defined Routes applied.

vnetImagePullEnabled.Description: To enable pulling image over Virtual Network

vnetContentShareEnabled.Description: To enable accessing content over virtual network

trafficManagerHostNames.Description: Azure Traffic Manager hostnames associated with the app. Read-only.

scmSiteAlsoStopped.Description: true to stop SCM (KUDU) site when the app is stopped; otherwise, false. The default is false.

targetSwapSlot.Description: Specifies which deployment slot this app will swap into. Read-only.

hostingEnvironmentProfile.Description: App Service Environment to use for the app.

clientAffinityEnabled.Description: true to enable client affinity; false to stop sending session affinity cookies, which route client requests in the same session to the same instance. Default is true.

clientCertEnabled.Description: true to enable client certificate authentication (TLS mutual authentication); otherwise, false. Default is false.

clientCertMode.Description:
This composes with ClientCertEnabled setting.
- ClientCertEnabled: false means ClientCert is ignored.
- ClientCertEnabled: true and ClientCertMode: Required means ClientCert is required.
- ClientCertEnabled: true and ClientCertMode: Optional means ClientCert is optional or accepted.

clientCertExclusionPaths.Description: client certificate authentication comma-separated exclusion paths

hostNamesDisabled.Description: true to disable the public hostnames of the app; otherwise, false. If true, the app is only accessible via API management process.

customDomainVerificationId.Description: Unique identifier that verifies the custom domains assigned to the app. Customer will add this id to a txt record for verification.

outboundIpAddresses.Description: List of IP addresses that the app uses for outbound connections (e.g. database access). Includes VIPs from tenants that site can be hosted with current settings. Read-only.

possibleOutboundIpAddresses.Description: List of IP addresses that the app uses for outbound connections (e.g. database access). Includes VIPs from all tenants except dataComponent. Read-only.

dailyMemoryTimeQuota.Description: Maximum allowed daily memory-time quota (applicable on dynamic apps only).

suspendedTill.Description: App suspended till in case memory-time quota is exceeded.

maxNumberOfWorkers.Description:
Maximum number of workers.
This only applies to Functions container.

cloningInfo.Description: If specified during app creation, the app is cloned from a source app.

resourceGroup.Description: Name of the resource group the app belongs to. Read-only.

isDefaultContainer.Description: true if the app is a default container; otherwise, false.

defaultHostName.Description: Default hostname of the app. Read-only.

slotSwapStatus.Description: Status of the last deployment slot swap operation.

httpsOnly.Description:
HttpsOnly: configures a web site to accept only https requests. Issues redirect for
http requests

inProgressOperationId.Description: Specifies an operation id if this site has a pending operation.

publicNetworkAccess.Description: Property to allow or block all public traffic. Allowed Values: 'Enabled', 'Disabled' or an empty string.

storageAccountRequired.Description: Checks if Customer provided storage account is required

keyVaultReferenceIdentity.Description: Identity to use for Key Vault Reference authentication.

virtualNetworkSubnetId.Description:
Azure Resource Manager ID of the Virtual network and subnet to be joined by Regional VNET Integration.
This must be of the form /subscriptions/{subscriptionName}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/{vnetName}/subnets/{subnetName}

virtualIP.Description: Virtual IP address assigned to the hostname if IP based SSL is enabled.

toUpdate.Description: Set to true to update existing hostname.

hostType.Description: Indicates whether the hostname is a standard or repository hostname.

requestTracingEnabled.Description: true if request tracing is enabled; otherwise, false.

remoteDebuggingEnabled.Description: true if remote debugging is enabled; otherwise, false.

httpLoggingEnabled.Description: true if HTTP logging is enabled; otherwise, false.

acrUseManagedIdentityCreds.Description: Flag to use Managed Identity Creds for ACR pull

acrUserManagedIdentityID.Description: If using user managed identity, the user managed identity ClientId

detailedErrorLoggingEnabled.Description: true if detailed error logging is enabled; otherwise, false.

alwaysOn.Description: true if Always On is enabled; otherwise, false.

experiments.Description: This is work around for polymorphic types.

autoHealEnabled.Description: true if Auto Heal is enabled; otherwise, false.

vnetRouteAllEnabled.Description: Virtual Network Route All enabled. This causes all outbound traffic to have Virtual Network Security Groups and User Defined Routes applied.

vnetPrivatePortsCount.Description: The number of private ports assigned to this app. These will be assigned dynamically on runtime.

apiDefinition.Description: Information about the formal API definition for the app.

apiManagementConfig.Description: Azure API management settings linked to the app.

keyVaultReferenceIdentity.Description: Identity to use for Key Vault Reference authentication.

scmIpSecurityRestrictionsUseMain.Description: IP security restrictions for scm to use main.

http20Enabled.Description: Http20Enabled: configures a web site to allow clients to connect over http2.0

minTlsVersion.Description: MinTlsVersion: configures the minimum version of TLS required for SSL requests

scmMinTlsVersion.Description: ScmMinTlsVersion: configures the minimum version of TLS required for SSL requests for SCM site

preWarmedInstanceCount.Description:
Number of preWarmed instances.
This setting only applies to the Consumption and Elastic Plans

functionAppScaleLimit.Description:
Maximum number of workers that a site can scale out to.
This setting only applies to the Consumption and Elastic Premium Plans

functionsRuntimeScaleMonitoringEnabled.Description:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether functions runtime scale monitoring is enabled. When enabled,
the ScaleController will not monitor event sources directly, but will instead call to the
runtime to get scale status.

websiteTimeZone.Description: Sets the time zone a site uses for generating timestamps. Compatible with Linux and Windows App Service. Setting the WEBSITE_TIME_ZONE app setting takes precedence over this config. For Linux, expects tz database values https://www.iana.org/time-zones (for a quick reference see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones). For Windows, expects one of the time zones listed under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Time Zones

minimumElasticInstanceCount.Description:
Number of minimum instance count for a site
This setting only applies to the Elastic Plans

publicNetworkAccess.Description: Property to allow or block all public traffic.

extension.Description: Requests with this extension will be handled using the specified FastCGI application.

scriptProcessor.Description: The absolute path to the FastCGI application.

arguments.Description: Command-line arguments to be passed to the script processor.

actionHostName.Description: Hostname of a slot to which the traffic will be redirected if decided to. E.g. myapp-stage.azurewebsites.net.

reroutePercentage.Description: Percentage of the traffic which will be redirected to ActionHostName.

changeStep.Description: In auto ramp up scenario this is the step to add/remove from ReroutePercentage until it reaches \nMinReroutePercentage or MaxReroutePercentage. Site metrics are checked every N minutes specified in ChangeIntervalInMinutes.\nCustom decision algorithm can be provided in TiPCallback site extension which URL can be specified in ChangeDecisionCallbackUrl.

changeIntervalInMinutes.Description: Specifies interval in minutes to reevaluate ReroutePercentage.

minReroutePercentage.Description: Specifies lower boundary above which ReroutePercentage will stay.

maxReroutePercentage.Description: Specifies upper boundary below which ReroutePercentage will stay.

changeDecisionCallbackUrl.Description:
Custom decision algorithm can be provided in TiPCallback site extension which URL can be specified. See TiPCallback site extension for the scaffold and contracts.
https://www.siteextensions.net/packages/TiPCallback/

name.Description: Name of the routing rule. The recommended name would be to point to the slot which will receive the traffic in the experiment.

maxMemoryInMb.Description: Maximum allowed memory usage in MB.

maxDiskSizeInMb.Description: Maximum allowed disk size usage in MB.

triggers.Description: Conditions that describe when to execute the auto-heal actions.

actions.Description: Actions to be executed when a rule is triggered.

requests.Description: A rule based on total requests.

privateBytesInKB.Description: A rule based on private bytes.

statusCodes.Description: A rule based on status codes.

slowRequests.Description: A rule based on request execution time.

slowRequestsWithPath.Description: A rule based on multiple Slow Requests Rule with path

statusCodesRange.Description: A rule based on status codes ranges.

minProcessExecutionTime.Description:
Minimum time the process must execute
before taking the action

allowedOrigins.Description:
Gets or sets the list of origins that should be allowed to make cross-origin
calls (for example: http://example.com:12345). Use "*" to allow all.

supportCredentials.Description:
Gets or sets whether CORS requests with credentials are allowed. See 
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/CORS#Requests_with_credentials
for more details.

isPushEnabled.Description: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether the Push endpoint is enabled.

tagWhitelistJson.Description: Gets or sets a JSON string containing a list of tags that are in the allowed list for use by the push registration endpoint.

tagsRequiringAuth.Description:
Gets or sets a JSON string containing a list of tags that require user authentication to be used in the push registration endpoint.
Tags can consist of alphanumeric characters and the following:
'_', '@', '#', '.', ':', '-'. 
Validation should be performed at the PushRequestHandler.

dynamicTagsJson.Description: Gets or sets a JSON string containing a list of dynamic tags that will be evaluated from user claims in the push registration endpoint.

url.Description: The URL of the API definition.

ipAddress.Description:
IP address the security restriction is valid for.
It can be in form of pure ipv4 address (required SubnetMask property) or
CIDR notation such as ipv4/mask (leading bit match). For CIDR,
SubnetMask property must not be specified.

subnetMask.Description: Subnet mask for the range of IP addresses the restriction is valid for.

action.Description: Allow or Deny access for this IP range.

tag.Description: Defines what this IP filter will be used for. This is to support IP filtering on proxies.

headers.Description:
IP restriction rule headers.
X-Forwarded-Host (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Forwarded-Host#Examples). 
The matching logic is ..
- If the property is null or empty (default), all hosts(or lack of) are allowed.
- A value is compared using ordinal-ignore-case (excluding port number).
- Subdomain wildcards are permitted but don't match the root domain. For example, *.contoso.com matches the subdomain foo.contoso.com
 but not the root domain contoso.com or multi-level foo.bar.contoso.com
- Unicode host names are allowed but are converted to Punycode for matching.

X-Forwarded-For (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Forwarded-For#Examples).
The matching logic is ..
- If the property is null or empty (default), any forwarded-for chains (or lack of) are allowed.
- If any address (excluding port number) in the chain (comma separated) matches the CIDR defined by the property.

X-Azure-FDID and X-FD-HealthProbe.
The matching logic is exact match.

shareName.Description: Name of the file share (container name, for Blob storage).

accessKey.Description: Access key for the storage account.

mountPath.Description: Path to mount the storage within the site's runtime environment.

correlationId.Description:
Correlation ID of cloning operation. This ID ties multiple cloning operations
together to use the same snapshot.

cloneCustomHostNames.Description: true to clone custom hostnames from source app; otherwise, false.

cloneSourceControl.Description: true to clone source control from source app; otherwise, false.

sourceWebAppId.Description:
ARM resource ID of the source app. App resource ID is of the form 
/subscriptions/{subId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Web/sites/{siteName} for production slots and 
/subscriptions/{subId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Web/sites/{siteName}/slots/{slotName} for other slots.

sourceWebAppLocation.Description: Location of source app ex: West US or North Europe

appSettingsOverrides.Description:
Application setting overrides for cloned app. If specified, these settings override the settings cloned 
from source app. Otherwise, application settings from source app are retained.

configureLoadBalancing.Description: true to configure load balancing for source and destination app.

trafficManagerProfileId.Description:
ARM resource ID of the Traffic Manager profile to use, if it exists. Traffic Manager resource ID is of the form 
/subscriptions/{subId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Network/trafficManagerProfiles/{profileName}.

trafficManagerProfileName.Description: Name of Traffic Manager profile to create. This is only needed if Traffic Manager profile does not already exist.

timestampUtc.Description: The time the last successful slot swap completed.

sourceSlotName.Description: The source slot of the last swap operation.

destinationSlotName.Description: The destination slot of the last swap operation.

allow.Description: true to allow access to a publishing method; otherwise, false.

enabled.Description: true if the Authentication / Authorization feature is enabled for the current app; otherwise, false.

runtimeVersion.Description:
The RuntimeVersion of the Authentication / Authorization feature in use for the current app.
The setting in this value can control the behavior of certain features in the Authentication / Authorization module.

unauthenticatedClientAction.Description: The action to take when an unauthenticated client attempts to access the app.

tokenStoreEnabled.Description: true to durably store platform-specific security tokens that are obtained during login flows; otherwise, false. The default is false.

allowedExternalRedirectUrls.Description:
External URLs that can be redirected to as part of logging in or logging out of the app. Note that the query string part of the URL is ignored.
This is an advanced setting typically only needed by Windows Store application backends.
Note that URLs within the current domain are always implicitly allowed.

defaultProvider.Description:
The default authentication provider to use when multiple providers are configured.
This setting is only needed if multiple providers are configured and the unauthenticated client
action is set to "RedirectToLoginPage".

tokenRefreshExtensionHours.Description:
The number of hours after session token expiration that a session token can be used to
call the token refresh API. The default is 72 hours.

clientId.Description:
The Client ID of this relying party application, known as the client_id.
This setting is required for enabling OpenID Connection authentication with Azure Active Directory or 
other 3rd party OpenID Connect providers.
More information on OpenID Connect: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html

clientSecret.Description:
The Client Secret of this relying party application (in Azure Active Directory, this is also referred to as the Key).
This setting is optional. If no client secret is configured, the OpenID Connect implicit auth flow is used to authenticate end users.
Otherwise, the OpenID Connect Authorization Code Flow is used to authenticate end users.
More information on OpenID Connect: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html

clientSecretSettingName.Description: The app setting name that contains the client secret of the relying party application.

clientSecretCertificateThumbprint.Description:
An alternative to the client secret, that is the thumbprint of a certificate used for signing purposes. This property acts as
a replacement for the Client Secret. It is also optional.

issuer.Description:
The OpenID Connect Issuer URI that represents the entity which issues access tokens for this application.
When using Azure Active Directory, this value is the URI of the directory tenant, e.g. https://sts.windows.net/{tenant-guid}/.
This URI is a case-sensitive identifier for the token issuer.
More information on OpenID Connect Discovery: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-discovery-1_0.html

validateIssuer.Description: Gets a value indicating whether the issuer should be a valid HTTPS url and be validated as such.

allowedAudiences.Description: Allowed audience values to consider when validating JWTs issued by Azure Active Directory. Note that the ClientID value is always considered an allowed audience, regardless of this setting.

additionalLoginParams.Description:
Login parameters to send to the OpenID Connect authorization endpoint when
a user logs in. Each parameter must be in the form "key=value".

aadClaimsAuthorization.Description: Gets a JSON string containing the Azure AD Acl settings.

googleClientId.Description:
The OpenID Connect Client ID for the Google web application.
This setting is required for enabling Google Sign-In.
Google Sign-In documentation: https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/

googleClientSecret.Description:
The client secret associated with the Google web application.
This setting is required for enabling Google Sign-In.
Google Sign-In documentation: https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/

googleClientSecretSettingName.Description:
The app setting name that contains the client secret associated with 
the Google web application.

googleOAuthScopes.Description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of Google Sign-In authentication.
This setting is optional. If not specified, "openid", "profile", and "email" are used as default scopes.
Google Sign-In documentation: https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/

facebookAppId.Description:
The App ID of the Facebook app used for login.
This setting is required for enabling Facebook Login.
Facebook Login documentation: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login

facebookAppSecret.Description:
The App Secret of the Facebook app used for Facebook Login.
This setting is required for enabling Facebook Login.
Facebook Login documentation: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login

facebookAppSecretSettingName.Description: The app setting name that contains the app secret used for Facebook Login.

facebookOAuthScopes.Description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of Facebook Login authentication.
This setting is optional.
Facebook Login documentation: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login

gitHubClientId.Description:
The Client Id of the GitHub app used for login.
This setting is required for enabling Github login

gitHubClientSecret.Description:
The Client Secret of the GitHub app used for Github Login.
This setting is required for enabling Github login.

gitHubClientSecretSettingName.Description:
The app setting name that contains the client secret of the Github
app used for GitHub Login.

gitHubOAuthScopes.Description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of GitHub Login authentication.
This setting is optional

twitterConsumerKey.Description:
The OAuth 1.0a consumer key of the Twitter application used for sign-in.
This setting is required for enabling Twitter Sign-In.
Twitter Sign-In documentation: https://dev.twitter.com/web/sign-in

twitterConsumerSecret.Description:
The OAuth 1.0a consumer secret of the Twitter application used for sign-in.
This setting is required for enabling Twitter Sign-In.
Twitter Sign-In documentation: https://dev.twitter.com/web/sign-in

twitterConsumerSecretSettingName.Description:
The app setting name that contains the OAuth 1.0a consumer secret of the Twitter
application used for sign-in.

microsoftAccountClientId.Description:
The OAuth 2.0 client ID that was created for the app used for authentication.
This setting is required for enabling Microsoft Account authentication.
Microsoft Account OAuth documentation: https://dev.onedrive.com/auth/msa_oauth.htm

microsoftAccountClientSecret.Description:
The OAuth 2.0 client secret that was created for the app used for authentication.
This setting is required for enabling Microsoft Account authentication.
Microsoft Account OAuth documentation: https://dev.onedrive.com/auth/msa_oauth.htm

microsoftAccountClientSecretSettingName.Description:
The app setting name containing the OAuth 2.0 client secret that was created for the
app used for authentication.

microsoftAccountOAuthScopes.Description:
The OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of Microsoft Account authentication.
This setting is optional. If not specified, "wl.basic" is used as the default scope.
Microsoft Account Scopes and permissions documentation: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn631845.aspx

isAuthFromFile.Description:
"true" if the auth config settings should be read from a file,
"false" otherwise

authFilePath.Description:
The path of the config file containing auth settings.
If the path is relative, base will the site's root directory.

configVersion.Description:
The ConfigVersion of the Authentication / Authorization feature in use for the current app.
The setting in this value can control the behavior of the control plane for Authentication / Authorization.

platform.Description: The configuration settings of the platform of App Service Authentication/Authorization.

globalValidation.Description: The configuration settings that determines the validation flow of users using App Service Authentication/Authorization.

identityProviders.Description: The configuration settings of each of the identity providers used to configure App Service Authentication/Authorization.

login.Description: The configuration settings of the login flow of users using App Service Authentication/Authorization.

httpSettings.Description: The configuration settings of the HTTP requests for authentication and authorization requests made against App Service Authentication/Authorization.

enabled.Description: true if the Authentication / Authorization feature is enabled for the current app; otherwise, false.

runtimeVersion.Description:
The RuntimeVersion of the Authentication / Authorization feature in use for the current app.
The setting in this value can control the behavior of certain features in the Authentication / Authorization module.

configFilePath.Description:
The path of the config file containing auth settings if they come from a file.
If the path is relative, base will the site's root directory.

requireAuthentication.Description: true if the authentication flow is required any request is made; otherwise, false.

unauthenticatedClientAction.Description: The action to take when an unauthenticated client attempts to access the app.

redirectToProvider.Description:
The default authentication provider to use when multiple providers are configured.
This setting is only needed if multiple providers are configured and the unauthenticated client
action is set to "RedirectToLoginPage".

excludedPaths.Description: The paths for which unauthenticated flow would not be redirected to the login page.

azureActiveDirectory.Description: The configuration settings of the Azure Active directory provider.

facebook.Description: The configuration settings of the Facebook provider.

gitHub.Description: The configuration settings of the GitHub provider.

google.Description: The configuration settings of the Google provider.

legacyMicrosoftAccount.Description: The configuration settings of the legacy Microsoft Account provider.

twitter.Description: The configuration settings of the Twitter provider.

apple.Description: The configuration settings of the Apple provider.

azureStaticWebApps.Description: The configuration settings of the Azure Static Web Apps provider.

customOpenIdConnectProviders.Description:
The map of the name of the alias of each custom Open ID Connect provider to the
configuration settings of the custom Open ID Connect provider.

enabled.Description: false if the Azure Active Directory provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

registration.Description: The configuration settings of the Azure Active Directory app registration.

login.Description: The configuration settings of the Azure Active Directory login flow.

validation.Description: The configuration settings of the Azure Active Directory token validation flow.

isAutoProvisioned.Description:
Gets a value indicating whether the Azure AD configuration was auto-provisioned using 1st party tooling.
This is an internal flag primarily intended to support the Azure Management Portal. Users should not
read or write to this property.

openIdIssuer.Description:
The OpenID Connect Issuer URI that represents the entity which issues access tokens for this application.
When using Azure Active Directory, this value is the URI of the directory tenant, e.g. https://login.microsoftonline.com/v2.0/{tenant-guid}/.
This URI is a case-sensitive identifier for the token issuer.
More information on OpenID Connect Discovery: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-discovery-1_0.html

clientId.Description:
The Client ID of this relying party application, known as the client_id.
This setting is required for enabling OpenID Connection authentication with Azure Active Directory or 
other 3rd party OpenID Connect providers.
More information on OpenID Connect: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html

clientSecretSettingName.Description: The app setting name that contains the client secret of the relying party application.

clientSecretCertificateThumbprint.Description:
An alternative to the client secret, that is the thumbprint of a certificate used for signing purposes. This property acts as
a replacement for the Client Secret. It is also optional.

clientSecretCertificateSubjectAlternativ.Description:
An alternative to the client secret thumbprint, that is the subject alternative name of a certificate used for signing purposes. This property acts as
a replacement for the Client Secret Certificate Thumbprint. It is also optional.

clientSecretCertificateIssuer.Description:
An alternative to the client secret thumbprint, that is the issuer of a certificate used for signing purposes. This property acts as
a replacement for the Client Secret Certificate Thumbprint. It is also optional.

loginParameters.Description:
Login parameters to send to the OpenID Connect authorization endpoint when
a user logs in. Each parameter must be in the form "key=value".

disableWWWAuthenticate.Description: true if the www-authenticate provider should be omitted from the request; otherwise, false.

jwtClaimChecks.Description: The configuration settings of the checks that should be made while validating the JWT Claims.

allowedAudiences.Description: The list of audiences that can make successful authentication/authorization requests.

defaultAuthorizationPolicy.Description: The configuration settings of the default authorization policy.

allowedGroups.Description: The list of the allowed groups.

allowedClientApplications.Description: The list of the allowed client applications.

allowedPrincipals.Description: The configuration settings of the Azure Active Directory allowed principals.

allowedApplications.Description: The configuration settings of the Azure Active Directory allowed applications.

groups.Description: The list of the allowed groups.

identities.Description: The list of the allowed identities.

enabled.Description: false if the Facebook provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

registration.Description: The configuration settings of the app registration for the Facebook provider.

graphApiVersion.Description: The version of the Facebook api to be used while logging in.

login.Description: The configuration settings of the login flow.

appId.Description: The App ID of the app used for login.

appSecretSettingName.Description: The app setting name that contains the app secret.

scopes.Description: A list of the scopes that should be requested while authenticating.

enabled.Description: false if the GitHub provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

registration.Description: The configuration settings of the app registration for the GitHub provider.

login.Description: The configuration settings of the login flow.

clientId.Description: The Client ID of the app used for login.

clientSecretSettingName.Description: The app setting name that contains the client secret.

enabled.Description: false if the Google provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

registration.Description: The configuration settings of the app registration for the Google provider.

login.Description: The configuration settings of the login flow.

validation.Description: The configuration settings of the Azure Active Directory token validation flow.

allowedAudiences.Description: The configuration settings of the allowed list of audiences from which to validate the JWT token.

enabled.Description: false if the legacy Microsoft Account provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

registration.Description: The configuration settings of the app registration for the legacy Microsoft Account provider.

login.Description: The configuration settings of the login flow.

validation.Description: The configuration settings of the legacy Microsoft Account provider token validation flow.

enabled.Description: false if the Twitter provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

registration.Description: The configuration settings of the app registration for the Twitter provider.

consumerKey.Description:
The OAuth 1.0a consumer key of the Twitter application used for sign-in.
This setting is required for enabling Twitter Sign-In.
Twitter Sign-In documentation: https://dev.twitter.com/web/sign-in

consumerSecretSettingName.Description:
The app setting name that contains the OAuth 1.0a consumer secret of the Twitter
application used for sign-in.

enabled.Description: false if the Apple provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

registration.Description: The configuration settings of the Apple registration.

login.Description: The configuration settings of the login flow.

clientId.Description: The Client ID of the app used for login.

clientSecretSettingName.Description: The app setting name that contains the client secret.

enabled.Description: false if the Azure Static Web Apps provider should not be enabled despite the set registration; otherwise, true.

registration.Description: The configuration settings of the Azure Static Web Apps registration.

clientId.Description: The Client ID of the app used for login.

enabled.Description: false if the custom Open ID provider provider should not be enabled; otherwise, true.

registration.Description: The configuration settings of the app registration for the custom Open ID Connect provider.

login.Description: The configuration settings of the login flow of the custom Open ID Connect provider.

clientId.Description: The client id of the custom Open ID Connect provider.

clientCredential.Description: The authentication credentials of the custom Open ID Connect provider.

openIdConnectConfiguration.Description: The configuration settings of the endpoints used for the custom Open ID Connect provider.

method.Description: The method that should be used to authenticate the user.

clientSecretSettingName.Description: The app setting that contains the client secret for the custom Open ID Connect provider.

authorizationEndpoint.Description: The endpoint to be used to make an authorization request.

tokenEndpoint.Description: The endpoint to be used to request a token.

issuer.Description: The endpoint that issues the token.

certificationUri.Description: The endpoint that provides the keys necessary to validate the token.

wellKnownOpenIdConfiguration.Description: The endpoint that contains all the configuration endpoints for the provider.

nameClaimType.Description: The name of the claim that contains the users name.

scopes.Description: A list of the scopes that should be requested while authenticating.

routes.Description: The routes that specify the endpoints used for login and logout requests.

tokenStore.Description: The configuration settings of the token store.

preserveUrlFragmentsForLogins.Description: true if the fragments from the request are preserved after the login request is made; otherwise, false.

allowedExternalRedirectUrls.Description:
External URLs that can be redirected to as part of logging in or logging out of the app. Note that the query string part of the URL is ignored.
This is an advanced setting typically only needed by Windows Store application backends.
Note that URLs within the current domain are always implicitly allowed.

cookieExpiration.Description: The configuration settings of the session cookie's expiration.

nonce.Description: The configuration settings of the nonce used in the login flow.

logoutEndpoint.Description: The endpoint at which a logout request should be made.

enabled.Description: true to durably store platform-specific security tokens that are obtained during login flows; otherwise, false. The default is false.

tokenRefreshExtensionHours.Description:
The number of hours after session token expiration that a session token can be used to
call the token refresh API. The default is 72 hours.

fileSystem.Description: The configuration settings of the storage of the tokens if a file system is used.

azureBlobStorage.Description: The configuration settings of the storage of the tokens if blob storage is used.

directory.Description: The directory in which the tokens will be stored.

sasUrlSettingName.Description: The name of the app setting containing the SAS URL of the blob storage containing the tokens.

convention.Description: The convention used when determining the session cookie's expiration.

timeToExpiration.Description: The time after the request is made when the session cookie should expire.

validateNonce.Description: false if the nonce should not be validated while completing the login flow; otherwise, true.

nonceExpirationInterval.Description: The time after the request is made when the nonce should expire.

requireHttps.Description: false if the authentication/authorization responses not having the HTTPS scheme are permissible; otherwise, true.

routes.Description: The configuration settings of the paths HTTP requests.

forwardProxy.Description: The configuration settings of a forward proxy used to make the requests.

apiPrefix.Description: The prefix that should precede all the authentication/authorization paths.

convention.Description: The convention used to determine the url of the request made.

customHostHeaderName.Description: The name of the header containing the host of the request.

customProtoHeaderName.Description: The name of the header containing the scheme of the request.

enabled.Description: True if the backup schedule is enabled (must be included in that case), false if the backup schedule should be disabled.

backupSchedule.Description: Schedule for the backup if it is executed periodically.

frequencyInterval.Description: How often the backup should be executed (e.g. for weekly backup, this should be set to 7 and FrequencyUnit should be set to Day)

frequencyUnit.Description: The unit of time for how often the backup should be executed (e.g. for weekly backup, this should be set to Day and FrequencyInterval should be set to 7)

keepAtLeastOneBackup.Description: True if the retention policy should always keep at least one backup in the storage account, regardless how old it is; false otherwise.

retentionPeriodInDays.Description: After how many days backups should be deleted.

startTime.Description: When the schedule should start working.

lastExecutionTime.Description: Last time when this schedule was triggered.

connectionStringName.Description:
Contains a connection string name that is linked to the SiteConfig.ConnectionStrings.
This is used during restore with overwrite connection strings options.

connectionString.Description: Contains a connection string to a database which is being backed up or restored. If the restore should happen to a new database, the database name inside is the new one.

fileSystem.Description: Application logs to file system configuration.

azureTableStorage.Description: Application logs to azure table storage configuration.

azureBlobStorage.Description: Application logs to blob storage configuration.

sasUrl.Description: SAS URL to an Azure table with add/query/delete permissions.
SAS url to a azure blob container with read/write/list/delete permissions.

retentionInDays.Description:
Retention in days.
Remove blobs older than X days.
0 or lower means no retention.

fileSystem.Description: Http logs to file system configuration.

azureBlobStorage.Description: Http logs to azure blob storage configuration.

retentionInMb.Description:
Maximum size in megabytes that http log files can use.
When reached old log files will be removed to make space for new ones.
Value can range between 25 and 100.

retentionInDays.Description:
Retention in days.
Remove files older than X days.
0 or lower means no retention.

enabled.Description: True if configuration is enabled, false if it is disabled and null if configuration is not set.

sasUrl.Description: SAS url to a azure blob container with read/write/list/delete permissions.

retentionInDays.Description:
Retention in days.
Remove blobs older than X days.
0 or lower means no retention.

enabled.Description: True if configuration is enabled, false if it is disabled and null if configuration is not set.
True if configuration is enabled, false if it is disabled and null if configuration is not set.

azureStorageConfigNames.Description: List of external Azure storage account identifiers.

active.Description: True if deployment is currently active, false if completed and null if not started.

setParametersXmlFileUri.Description: URI of MSDeploy Parameters file. Must not be set if SetParameters is used.

setParameters.Description: MSDeploy Parameters. Must not be set if SetParametersXmlFileUri is used.

skipAppData.Description: Controls whether the MSDeploy operation skips the App_Data directory. If set to true, the existing App_Data directory on the destination will not be deleted, and any App_Data directory in the source will be ignored. Setting is false by default.

appOffline.Description: Sets the AppOffline rule while the MSDeploy operation executes. Setting is false by default.

complete.Description: Whether the deployment operation has completed

test_data.Description: Test data used when testing via the Azure Portal.

isDisabled.Description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the function is disabled

domainId.Description: Fully qualified ARM domain resource URI.

virtualIP.Description: Virtual IP address assigned to the hostname if IP based SSL is enabled.

serviceBusNamespace.Description: The name of the Service Bus namespace.

relayName.Description: The name of the Service Bus relay.

relayArmUri.Description: The ARM URI to the Service Bus relay.

sendKeyName.Description: The name of the Service Bus key which has Send permissions. This is used to authenticate to Service Bus.

sendKeyValue.Description:
The value of the Service Bus key. This is used to authenticate to Service Bus. In ARM this key will not be returned
normally, use the POST /listKeys API instead.

serviceBusSuffix.Description: The suffix for the service bus endpoint. By default this is .servicebus.windows.net

subnetResourceId.Description: The Virtual Network subnet's resource ID. This is the subnet that this Web App will join. This subnet must have a delegation to Microsoft.Web/serverFarms defined first.

swiftSupported.Description: A flag that specifies if the scale unit this Web App is on supports Swift integration.

enabled.Description: Whether private access is enabled or not.

virtualNetworks.Description: The Virtual Networks (and subnets) allowed to access the site privately.

name.Description: The name of the Virtual Network.

key.Description: The key (ID) of the Virtual Network.

resourceId.Description: The ARM uri of the Virtual Network

subnets.Description: A List of subnets that access is allowed to on this Virtual Network. An empty array (but not null) is interpreted to mean that all subnets are allowed within this Virtual Network.

local_is_latest_version.Description: true if the local version is the latest version; false otherwise.

branch.Description: Name of branch to use for deployment.

isManualIntegration.Description: true to limit to manual integration; false to enable continuous integration (which configures webhooks into online repos like GitHub).

isGitHubAction.Description: true if this is deployed via GitHub action.

isMercurial.Description: true for a Mercurial repository; false for a Git repository.

gitHubActionConfiguration.Description: If GitHub Action is selected, than the associated configuration.

isLinux.Description: This will help determine the workflow configuration to select.

generateWorkflowFile.Description: Workflow option to determine whether the workflow file should be generated and written to the repository.

runtimeStack.Description: Runtime stack is used to determine the workflow file content for code base apps.

runtimeVersion.Description: Runtime version is used to determine what build version to set in the workflow file.

serverUrl.Description: The server URL for the container registry where the build will be hosted.

imageName.Description: The image name for the build.

username.Description: The username used to upload the image to the container registry.

password.Description: The password used to upload the image to the container registry.

certBlob.Description:
A certificate file (.cer) blob containing the public key of the private key used to authenticate a 
Point-To-Site VPN connection.

routes.Description: The routes that this Virtual Network connection uses.

resyncRequired.Description: true if a resync is required; otherwise, false.

dnsServers.Description: DNS servers to be used by this Virtual Network. This should be a comma-separated list of IP addresses.

isSwift.Description: Flag that is used to denote if this is VNET injection

internalIpAddress.Description: Virtual Network internal IP address of the App Service Environment if it is in internal load-balancing mode.

outboundIpAddresses.Description: IP addresses appearing on outbound connections.

inUse.Description: Is virtual IP mapping in use.

serviceName.Description: name of the service that virtual IP is assigned to

current.Description: The current number of Hybrid Connections.

maximum.Description: The maximum number of Hybrid Connections allowed.

createdTime.Description:
Timestamp describing when the revision was created
by controller

fqdn.Description: Fully qualified domain name of the revision

template.Description:
Container App Revision Template with all possible settings and the
defaults if user did not provide them. The defaults are populated
as they were at the creation time

active.Description: Boolean describing if the Revision is Active

replicas.Description: Number of pods currently running for this revision

trafficWeight.Description: Traffic weight assigned to this revision

healthState.Description: Current health State of the revision

provisioningState.Description: Current provisioning State of the revision

deletedSiteId.Description: Numeric id for the deleted site

deletedTimestamp.Description: Time in UTC when the app was deleted.

resourceGroup.Description: ResourceGroup that contained the deleted site

kind.Description: Kind of site that was deleted

geoRegionName.Description: Geo Region of the deleted site

status.Description: Indicates status of the most severe insight.

dataProvidersMetadata.Description: Additional configuration for different data providers to be used by the UI

suggestedUtterances.Description: Suggested utterances where the detector can be applicable.

description.Description: Short description of the detector and its purpose.

category.Description: Problem category. This serves for organizing group for detectors.

supportTopicList.Description: List of Support Topics for which this detector is enabled.

analysisType.Description: Analysis Types for which this detector should apply to.

type.Description: Whether this detector is an Analysis Detector or not.

score.Description: Defines score of a detector to power ML based matching.

renderingProperties.Description: Properties that describe how the table should be rendered

columns.Description: List of columns with data types

dataType.Description: Data type which looks like 'String' or 'Int32'.

description.Description: Description of the data that will help it be interpreted

statusId.Description: Level of the most severe insight generated by the detector.

results.Description: Array of utterance results for search query.

qid.Description: Question id of sample utterance (for stackoverflow questions titles).

isEnabled.Description: Flag representing whether detector is enabled or not.

displayName.Description: UI friendly name of the rule.

message.Description: Localized name of the rule (Good for UI).

recommendationId.Description:
Recommendation ID of an associated recommendation object tied to the rule, if exists.
If such an object doesn't exist, it is set to null.

description.Description: Localized detailed description of the rule.

actionName.Description: Name of action that is recommended by this rule in string.

level.Description: Level of impact indicating how critical this rule is.

channels.Description: List of available channels that this rule applies.

categoryTags.Description: The list of category tags that this recommendation rule belongs to.

isDynamic.Description: True if this is associated with a dynamically added rule

extensionName.Description: Extension name of the portal if exists. Applicable to dynamic rule only.

bladeName.Description: Deep link to a blade on the portal. Applicable to dynamic rule only.

forwardLink.Description: Forward link to an external document associated with the rule. Applicable to dynamic rule only.

category.Description: The category that the resource matches in the RHC Policy File

signalAvailability.Description: Is there a health signal for the resource

buildId.Description: An identifier for the static site build.

pullRequestTitle.Description: The title of a pull request that a static site build is related to.

hostname.Description: The hostname for a static site build.

status.Description: The status of the static site build.

userProvidedFunctionApps.Description: User provided function apps registered with the static site build

linkedBackends.Description: Backends linked to the static side build

storageAccountUrl.Description: SAS URL for the storage account container which contains this backup.

blobName.Description: Name of the blob which contains data for this backup.

sizeInBytes.Description: Size of the backup in bytes.

log.Description: Details regarding this backup. Might contain an error message.

databases.Description: List of databases included in the backup.

scheduled.Description: True if this backup has been created due to a schedule being triggered.

lastRestoreTimeStamp.Description: Timestamp of a last restore operation which used this backup.

correlationId.Description: Unique correlation identifier. Please use this along with the timestamp while communicating with Azure support.

websiteSizeInBytes.Description: Size of the original web app which has been backed up.

numberOfInstancesInProgress.Description: Number of site instances currently being provisioned.

numberOfInstancesSuccessful.Description: Number of site instances provisioned successfully.

numberOfInstancesFailed.Description: Number of site instances failed to provision.

failedInstancesLogs.Description: List of URLs pointing to logs for instances which failed to provision.

statusUrl.Description: Link to the GetStatusApi in Kudu

detectorUrl.Description: Link to the Diagnose and Solve Portal

consoleUrl.Description: Link to the console to web app instance

healthCheckUrl.Description: Link to the console to web app instance

base_address.Description: Base address. Used as module identifier in ARM resource URI.

operationId.Description: Operation ID for the migration task.

localMySqlEnabled.Description: True if the web app has in app MySql enabled

hybridConnectionsV2.Description: The Hybrid Connection V2 (Service Bus) view.

publicNetworkAccess.Description: Property to allow or block all public traffic. Allowed Values: 'Enabled', 'Disabled' or an empty string.

storageAccountRequired.Description: Checks if Customer provided storage account is required

runs.Description: List of triggered web job runs.

workflow.Description: Gets the reference to workflow version.

response.Description: Gets the response of the flow run.

algorithm.Description: The algorithm of the content hash.

value.Description: The value of the content hash.

message.Description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

properties.Description: The workflow run action repetition properties definition.

startTime.Description: The start time of the workflow scope repetition.

endTime.Description: The end time of the workflow scope repetition.

status.Description: The status of the workflow scope repetition.

headers.Description: A list of all the headers attached to the request.

method.Description: The HTTP method used for the request.

headers.Description: A list of all the headers attached to the response.

statusCode.Description: The status code of the response.

bodyLink.Description: Details on the location of the body content.

properties.Description: The workflow run action repetition properties definition.
Gets the workflow trigger history properties.

inputsLink.Description: Gets the link to input parameters.

outputsLink.Description: Gets the link to output parameters.

fired.Description: The value indicating whether trigger was fired.

run.Description: Gets the reference to workflow run.

triggers.Description: The access control configuration for invoking workflow triggers.

contents.Description: The access control configuration for accessing workflow run contents.

actions.Description: The access control configuration for workflow actions.

workflowManagement.Description: The access control configuration for workflow management.

allowedCallerIpAddresses.Description: The allowed caller IP address ranges.

sendKeyName.Description: The name of the send key.

sendKeyValue.Description: The value of the send key.

nextLink.Description: Link to next page of resources.

provider.Description: The identity provider for the static site user.

userId.Description: The user id for the static site user.

displayName.Description: The display name for the static site user.

roles.Description: The roles for the static site user, in free-form string format

nextLink.Description: Link to next page of resources.
The link used to get the next page of recommendations.

value.Description: Gets the workflow trigger callback URL.

method.Description: Gets the workflow trigger callback URL HTTP method.

basePath.Description: Gets the workflow trigger callback URL base path.

relativePath.Description: Gets the workflow trigger callback URL relative path.

relativePathParameters.Description: Gets the workflow trigger callback URL relative path parameters.

queries.Description: Gets the workflow trigger callback URL query parameters.
